Description: Lower body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery squat lekythos; interior reserved; exterior: glazed black with reserved panel: uncertain decoration only marginally preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski interprets the decoration as remains of a red-figured palmette and gives the following comparanda: Robinson, Olynthus XIII (1950) 146ff pl. 101ff; see especially Venit 1988, p. 106, 206 no. 374 pl. 79 (Alexandria 17211)
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.43 no. C 26 pl. 17.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1952)
